p: The histological appearance showed a normal appearance of tissue without any significant lesions in the control group ( Figure 5(a)). Haemorrhage and a large number of neutrophils infiltrated the interstitial tissue in Carr-treated group ( Figure 5(b)). CS-LO (200 mg/kg) and Indo reduced the number of neutrophils compared with the Carr-treated group (Figures 5(c) and 5(d)). There were no inflammation, iNOS, and COX-2 immunoreactive cells (Figures 5(e) and 5(i)); however, a large number of iNOS and COX-2 immunoreactive cells were found in brown parts of the plantar biopsy tissue at 5 h after injection of Carr (Figures 5(f) and 5(j)). Indo and CS-LO (200 mg/kg) significantly inhibited the iNOS and COX-2 immunoreactive cells in the paw tissue (Figures 5(g), 5(h), 5(k), and 5(l)).
